name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
benefits: ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments via DBT

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
benefits: Crop insurance: coverage for yield loss, prevented sowing, post-harvest losses

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthan Mahabhiyan (PM-KUSUM)
benefits: Subsidy for installing solar pumps; support for solar power use in irrigation

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PM-KMY)
benefits: Assured pension of ₹3,000 per month after the age of 60. Spouse eligible for 50% family pension after subscriber’s death.

contribution.shared: Equal monthly contribution by farmer and Government

implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
benefits: Financial assistance and subsidies for irrigation infrastructure, micro-irrigation (drip & sprinkler systems), watershed development, and improving on-farm water use efficiency.

implementation.mode: Central Sector & Centrally Sponsored Scheme components
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Jal Shakti, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
benefits: Free soil testing and issuance of Soil Health Cards every 3 years to farmers, providing recommendations on nutrient management and fertilizer use to improve soil health and crop productivity.

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
benefits: Provides short-term credit support for cultivation, post-harvest expenses, working capital for allied activities, and consumption needs. Interest subvention available for timely repayment.

credit_limit.minimum: Based on scale of finance and cropping pattern
credit_limit.maximum: Up to ₹3 lakh for crop loans; higher limits for allied activities

implementation.mode: Issued by banks (Public, Private, RRBs, Cooperative Banks)
implementation.insurance: Covers crops under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
benefits: Financial assistance to promote cluster-based organic farming, certification support, organic input support, and market linkage for organic produce.
objectives: Promote sustainable organic farming practices
Reduce dependence on chemical fertilizers and pesticides
Enhance soil fertility and biodiversity
Support organic certification and branding

implementation.financial_assistance: ₹50,000 per hectare over 3 years (including organic inputs, certification, and training)
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
benefits: Financial assistance, training, and input support to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, and commercial crops through productivity enhancement and technology promotion.
objectives: Increase production and productivity of major food crops
Promote sustainable agricultural practices
Bridge yield gaps in identified districts
Improve farm-level economy and food security

implementation.mode: Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented through State Governments
implementation.nodal_agency: Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India

name: Rythu Bandhu Scheme
benefits: Investment support of ₹5,000 per acre per crop for two crops in a year, provided directly to farmers’ bank accounts to cover input costs like seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.
objectives: Provide financial support to cover crop input costs
Increase farmers’ income and reduce dependency on loans
Encourage timely investment in agriculture for higher productivity

implementation.mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to farmer’s bank account
implementation.frequency: Twice a year (for kharif and rabi seasons)
implementation.nodal_agency: Department of Agriculture, Telangana State Government

name: Bhavantar Bhugtan Yojana
benefits: Financial compensation to farmers when the market price of certain crops falls below the Minimum Support Price (MSP), helping to reduce income losses.
objectives: Stabilize farmers’ income for select crops
Reduce distress sales in the market
Encourage crop diversification based on market trends

implementation.mode: Payment transferred directly to farmers’ bank accounts
implementation.frequency: After harvest and market price verification
implementation.nodal_agency: Agriculture Department, Madhya Pradesh State Government

name: Building and Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Scheme (BOCW)
benefits: Welfare benefits like medical assistance, education support for children, pension, insurance & death benefit

name: Pension for Building & Other Construction Workers
benefits: Monthly pension after age 60

name: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan-Dhan (PM-SYM)
benefits: Assured minimum pension of ₹3,000 per month after attaining age 60; spouse eligible for 50% family pension after subscriber’s death.

contribution.shared: Monthly contribution shared between worker and government

implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Labour & Employment, Government of India

name: BOCW Welfare Schemes
benefits: Medical assistance for workers and dependents
Education support for children
Accident and life insurance
Maternity benefits for women workers
Financial assistance for tools or skill development
Pension for old-age workers

implementation.mode: State-specific welfare boards under BOCW Act

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Labour Category
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹1.20 lakh (plain areas) to ₹1.30 lakh (hilly states) for construction of pucca house. Additional subsidy for toilet construction under Swachh Bharat Mission.
objectives: Provide affordable housing to construction workers
Improve living standards and dignity
Promote homeownership among unorganized workers

implementation.mode: Direct Benefit Transfer after construction milestones
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs, State BOCW Boards
implementation.verification: Technical and financial inspection at different stages

name: Emergency Assistance Scheme for Construction Workers
benefits: Immediate financial assistance ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹50,000 depending on the nature of emergency. Additional support for medical treatment, funeral expenses, or disaster rehabilitation.
objectives: Provide immediate relief during emergencies
Prevent workers from falling into debt traps
Ensure social security during crisis situations

implementation.mode: Fast-track processing within 15 days of application

name: Skill Development & Training Scheme for Construction Workers
benefits: Free skill development training in construction trades (plumbing, electrical, masonry, carpentry), certification upon completion, job placement assistance, and tool kit support worth ₹5,000-15,000.
objectives: Upgrade technical skills of construction workers
Increase employability and income potential
Promote safety practices in construction
Bridge skill gaps in construction industry

implementation.mode: Partnership with ITIs, skill development centers, and private training providers
implementation.nodal_agency: Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship, State BOCW Boards
implementation.certification: National Skill Qualification Framework (NSQF) aligned certificates

name: Maternity Benefits for Women Construction Workers
benefits: Maternity benefit of ₹12,000-25,000 (varies by state) paid in installments during pregnancy and post-delivery. Additional medical assistance, nutritional support, and crèche facilities where available.

payment_schedule.third_installment: After 6 months (conditional on child health checkups)

objectives: Support women workers during maternity
Ensure proper nutrition for mother and child
Reduce infant and maternal mortality
Promote child immunization and healthcare

implementation.mode: Direct Benefit Transfer linked with ASHA/ANM verification
implementation.nodal_agency: State BOCW Welfare Boards in coordination with Health Department
implementation.additional_support: Links with Janani Suraksha Yojana and other maternity schemes

name: Education Scholarship Scheme for Children of Construction Workers
benefits: Educational scholarships ranging from ₹1,000 (primary) to ₹20,000 (technical/professional courses) per year. Additional support for books, uniforms, and examination fees.
objectives: Promote education among construction workers' children
Break the cycle of intergenerational poverty
Encourage higher education and skill development
Reduce child labor in construction sector

implementation.mode: Annual scholarship based on academic performance

name: Group Accident Insurance Scheme for Construction Workers
benefits: Comprehensive accident insurance coverage: ₹2 lakh for accidental death, ₹1 lakh for permanent disability, ₹50,000 for partial disability, and medical expenses up to ₹25,000 for accident-related treatment.
objectives: Provide financial security against workplace accidents
Reduce financial burden on families during emergencies
Encourage safety practices at construction sites
Ensure quick claim settlement for accident victims

implementation.mode: Group insurance policy with nominated insurance companies

name: Tool Kit and Equipment Subsidy Scheme
benefits: One-time subsidy of ₹8,000-15,000 for purchasing professional tools and equipment. Includes basic tool kit for specific trades, safety equipment, and maintenance support.

tool_kit_components.mason: Trowels, levels, measuring tape, floats, safety gear
tool_kit_components.carpenter: Saws, chisels, planes, drilling machine, measuring tools
tool_kit_components.plumber: Pipe cutters, wrenches, soldering equipment, testing tools
tool_kit_components.electrician: Multimeter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, safety equipment
tool_kit_components.painter: Brushes, rollers, spray gun, mixing equipment

objectives: Improve work efficiency and income potential
Promote ownership of quality tools
Enhance safety at construction sites
Support skilled workers in establishing independent practice

implementation.mode: Direct procurement or reimbursement after purchase verification
